f6_assessments.q0: I am supportive of the idea of endangered language preservation, and am very interested to learn more. I think this proposal has the beginnings of an interesting and impactful project, but is lacking in many details. The problem of disappearing languages is clearly stated, and the author references the connection to the SDGs. However I would have been interested to understand how exactly language preservation fits within the SDG framework. I also would welcome more details about how exactly the proposal will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. I can imagine a number of ways, but nothing is articulated in the proposal. Regarding scalability, it would be helpful to know if one language will be initially targeted, or if the idea is to build tools that could be used by any community with its own endangered language.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has provided no evidence of relevant skills and experience beyond general links about language resources that were dropped into the comments.  The funds requested are high - 10,000, which is 1/3 of this challenge. But there is no explanation of how those funds would be spent. There is no information about a timetable. I don't even understand what would be implemented (see comments above) and nothing is provided for an implementation plan. NFTs and metadata are mentioned, but it would be very helpful to understand exactly how a language would be represented through NFTs.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal lacks a roadmap, any mention of milestones, metrics, or KPIs. Without more specifics, it would be impossible to measure whether the proposed solution is effectively addressing the problem. This is very exciting idea and with a bit of work to fill in some of the gaps could become an innovative and exciting proposal.
